references.paper_title: The one-inclusion graph algorithm is not always optimal
references.reason: This paper provides a counterexample to a conjecture regarding the optimality of a graph-based algorithm for transductive learning, thus motivating the need for more nuanced analysis.

references.paper_title: Optimal pac bounds without uniform convergence
references.reason: This paper establishes optimal sample complexity bounds for PAC learning, demonstrating improvements over previous results and offering valuable insights into the nature of learnability.

references.paper_title: Optimal learners for realizable regression: PAC learning and online learning
references.reason: This paper provides the first general characterization of learnability for supervised learning, thus contributing significantly to the theoretical understanding of the field.

references.paper_title: A theory of pac learnability of partial concept classes
references.reason: This paper develops a theoretical framework for understanding PAC learnability in settings where the learner has access to only a subset of the data, thus providing insights into the complexities of learning from incomplete information.
This paper addresses fundamental questions regarding the decidability of learnability, showing that determining whether a concept class is learnable can be computationally intractable.
